JavaScript Exams Schedule - Semester 1, Academic Year 2023-2024

Group Exam Type Date and Time Room
120, 118, 321 Main 25.01.2024, 10:00 M308, D339, S343
229 Main 28.01.2024, 14:00 I308, V339
298, 275, 277 Main 09.02.2024, 11:00 H308, B336, B307, B320
All Groups Retake 19.02.2024, 15:00 B336, B339, C343

Notes

  • If you need to present on a secondary date, please use one of the exam dates for the other groups;
  • The exam for group 225 could not be scheduled in Academic Info;
  • Students from the Mathematical Informatics specialization are requested to attend the exam with the group they attended the lab with.

At the Beginning of the Semester

  • Please join the team with the code 'mksdlaws';
  • Remember, learning is a journey, not a race. Students from various backgrounds are allowed a maximum of 2 attendances in a laboratory. Choose your laboratory subgroup within the first two weeks of classes.;
  • Students from other specializations (Mathematics in Romanian), other faculties, and retake students will be accepted a maximum of 2 times in a laboratory. These students are requested to choose the laboratory subgroup they will attend (the same throughout the semester) in the first 2 weeks of the teaching activities;
  • Students from the specializations Mathematics in English or Computer Science in English are kindly asked to attend the course and laboratories coordinated by Assoc. Prof. Dr. John Doe (Computer Networks, MLE5002).

Requirements and Evaluation Method

  • Quizzes and Assignments (20%):
    • Weekly quizzes to assess understanding of key concepts.
    • Coding assignments to apply theoretical knowledge in practical scenarios.
  • Midterm Exam (30%):
    • A comprehensive midterm exam covering topics from the first half of the course.
  • Final Project (40%):
    • Capstone project where students apply their knowledge to build a web application.
    • Evaluation based on functionality, code quality, and adherence to best practices.
  • Participation and Attendance (10%):
    • Active participation in class discussions and group activities.
    • Regular attendance and engagement with course content.
  • Note:
    • Students must achieve a minimum passing grade of 60% to successfully complete the course.
    • Continuous learning and engagement are essential for mastering JavaScript; therefore, attendance and participation carry weight in the evaluation.

Course Objectives

  • Understand the fundamental concepts of JavaScript programming
  • Develop proficiency in using JavaScript for web development.
  • Explore advanced JavaScript features and best practices.
  • Gain practical experience in building web applications with JavaScript.
  • Apply JavaScript in asynchronous programming and API interactions.
  • Learn debugging and testing techniques for JavaScript code.
  • Explore modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries.

Course content

Module Topic
1 Introduction to JavaScript
2 JavaScript Fundamentals
3 Functions in JavaScript
4 Document Object Model (DOM) Manipualtion
5 Asynchronous JavaScript
6 Web APIs and AJAX
7 Modern JavaScript Features
8 Testing and Debugging
9 Version Control and Collaboration
10 Final Project
